direction.raw_text: The ad depicts videotaped scenes from Wisconsin's north country-- a farmer and a cow, a woman waterskiing, a guy mowing his lawn. A flat, nasally V.O. accompanies the images.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) The Brown River Valley: It's where we work. It's where we play. It's where we live. But even here in paradise, accidents can happen. The ad wipes to an inappropriately gruesome photo of an obviously fatal car wreck. The NARRATOR is chroma-keyed over the image. He is ROGER LEMKE, 40, blandly charismatic, with a blonde moustache that evokes a low-rent Tom Selleck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At Northlands Insurance, our goal is to provide high quality insurance services and related products to businesses and individuals in Wisconsin's Northlands. I'm Roger Lemke. Not only do I care about you, we also endeavor to give you the coverage you need at the best prices around. It's that reason Northlands has been awarded the prestigious Two Diamond Award from the American Society of Mutual Insurers three years running. Because at Northlands Insurance, we insure your dreams. The car accident photo dissolves into a sunset. The treacly music crescendos and we:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ad has been playing on a 13-inch TV in a small, wood- paneled office. A handful of EMPLOYEES and FAMILY MEMBERS applaud wildly. The proud owner of Northlands, BILL KROGSTAD, 60, embraces the man of the hour, Roger Lemke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ho-lee Christmas, knocked her outta the park, Roger! Out of the G-D park, you sonofagun!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09 ROGER LEMKE Hell, I'm just a pretty face, Bill. That copy was all you. Do got one little gripe though, boss-- if you'd waited until after Cedar Rapids we could've said winner of the Two Diamonds four years running!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aroo-aroo! Two Diamonds! Two Diamonds! The men roughhouse playfully. Roger's comely wife, GWEN, 30, holding their milk-fed TWIN TODDLERS, gives Roger a kiss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So proud of you, Roggie. God, you rock. Doesn't your dad rock, boys?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (an Elvis impersonation) Thank you. Thank you very much! More laughter and backslapping. After a bit, an as yet unseen
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hesitantly approaches. He gently touches Roger's arm, not wanting to interrupt the revelry. Roger turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tim! Timmy Lippe! Didn't even know you were here. You see it, bud?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (earnest, deeply admiring) Oh, heck yeah. You were awesome. Despite appearances to the contrary, this is our hero: TIM LIPPE (pronounced Lippy), 34, wholesome and positive, though undercurrents of desperation lurk just behind his kind eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just super... super awesome. Man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Y'know what Tim, I want people to see the insurance game for what it really is-- it's a noble field. I believe that. Like I say, we're not just insuring vehicles and homes and that. Hell no. We're insuring people's dreams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Yeah. I say that, too... sometimes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09 ROGER LEMKE Well shit, you do, don't you? By god, I stole your line! Knew I'd heard that somewhere!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no biggie...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bummer they cut your little deal outta the ad, though.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ach. Y'know. Got left on the ol'...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: interrupts, accosts Roger and ignores Tim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roger! Look out Brad Pitt!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ol' cutting room floor, right? (upon being ignored) Brad Pitt. Ha. That's... (then, with forced nonchalance) Whoa. Cake. Cool. Tim goes to the cake table. He smiles at the cake, impressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So awesome. The icing on the cake, a frosted visage of Roger Lemke, smiles back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A beige Buick Skylark splashes through a puddle of snow melt in the glum, isolated hamlet of Brown Valley, WI (pop: 337). Tim bops his head and sings along as a Parliament song plays on a Good Times, Great Oldies radio station. A dour OLD LADY shoveling her driveway stares as he passes by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Skylark pulls into the driveway of a tidy umber-colored rambler with a nature scene painted on the garage door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09 INT. TIM'S KITCHEN - DAY Flowered wallpaper. Vinyl flooring. A spoon collection. The room looks like someone's grandmother designed it. Tim enters. He opens the fridge, grabs an A & W Root Beer. He opens a cupboard, removes a box of Hostess Cupcakes. He sits at the Formica kitchen table, meticulously eats the cupcake, sips the soda pop and stares out the window at a bird feeder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tim's bedroom looks like that of a fastidious teenager. Twin bed. Orderly desk. Milwaukee Brewers poster (circa 1987). Tim removes his penny loafers, pleated khakis and Northlands Insurance polo shirt. He puts on a different pair of pleated khakis, a maroon turtleneck and some Top-siders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tim enters another bedroom. This one has a four-poster bed-- clearly a parents room, clearly unused. He opens the closet. A label reads GIFT CLOSET!!! Each shelf is neatly organized: Toys, knickknacks, occasion-specific greeting cards. He selects a Get Well card and a Beanie Baby duck, Quackers. A doorbell RINGS. Tim hurriedly signs the card. He licks the envelope as he hustles to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tim opens the door to MILLIE VANDERHEI, 54, a thick, depressive woman dressed like a 7th grade science teacher.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There she is! How you feeling?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, it's no big whoop. Tim pulls the card and Beanie Baby duck from behind his back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ta-da. (re. the stuffed duck) Quack, quack. D'you already have this guy? Wasn't sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09 MILLIE Gayle Syrstad gave me a Quackers for Secret Santa last year. I can probably trade with Nan, though. Millie sits on Tim's paisley sofa. She opens the card. On the front: a Rottweiler in a nurse's outfit. Inside: "Get Well or You Deal with Me!" Then in Tim's writing, "Love, Tim."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (chuckles at the card) Cute. Brandy would never sit still long enough for me to dress her up like that. Tell you that right now. (THEN) You didn't have to do this whole rigmarole, Tim. I told you it's just a little diarrhea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. But for you to miss a day of school, Millie... I can't remember you ever calling in sick when I had you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well I wasn't going through menopause when you were in middle school now was I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Negative. Not to my knowledge. Not to my knowledge. She nods somberly. They sit there silently for a bit. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So. Does your tummy feel good enough to...? They exchange a look...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Millie rides Tim. Tim palms her breasts. He still has on the maroon turtleneck. And one brown sock. Their bodies make a sound like two soft, thick hands apathetically applauding: Clap-pfft, clop-pfft, clap-ffft. The twin bed squeaks disapprovingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09 TIM I can try and... hold it, Mil. Can you...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bring it home. Bring it home. She waggles her hips with a bit more gusto. He grimaces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm bringing it. Bringing it! Bringing it! D'aaaarrgho'awesome... Tim exhales. Millie exhales. That worked out well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Millie and Tim watch American Idol. A WOMAN sings Queen's
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Tim harmonizes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ooh, you make me live! You're my best friend!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon Tim, I can't hear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. But you are, babygirl. (SINGS) You're my best friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tss. Goofball. The song ends. They sit quietly for a bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Y'know Galen and Dar Krause just did a cruise to the Bahamas? Pretty reasonable they said, price-wise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (mediocre Jamaican accent) Ya mon, Bahama-mama.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a little different I suppose-- a cruise. But... A beat, then Millie removes a cruise brochure from her purse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09 MILLIE (CONT'D) Look, I'm not gonna shilly-shally around here, Tim. I found a river cruise through Germany-- Viking Line, real grade-A. It's what I want. For the honeymoon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. Wait... Where's this coming from? We agreed on Wisconsin Dells for the honeymoon. It's what we agreed on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've been to the Dells two dozen times...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So? Roger and Gwen Lemke go to the Dells every year...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because they have children. Water parks are for children...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Tommy Bartlett's Ski, Sky and Stage Show? It's not just a water park...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Timothy, settle. You've never even left the state of Wisconsin. Barely left Brown Valley...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's so great about...? You're not... You're missing the... We agreed on the Dells. He avoids eye contact. Millie takes Tim's chin in her hands, forcing him to look at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God rest her. Your mom was my best friend. But it's going on 20 years now. You gotta grow up. You gotta let go. You gotta live a life here. See?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm living a perfectly fine life. I don't know why you'd want to... (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09 TIM (CONT'D) rock the waters or whatever. Ridiculous. Tim looks away again, pouting. Millie gives him a motherly hug. Over her shoulder, Tim watches a TEENAGER belting out
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on American Idol. Then, almost inaudibly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We agreed on the Dells.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a phone RINGS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tim sleeps alone in his twin bed. The phone rings again. Tim wakes with a start. He flips on the lamp, picks up the phone:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello... Oh, hey Bill... A look of profound anguish appears on Tim's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw jeez. Oh my gosh. No... The sound of a church organ playing ON EAGLES WINGS fades in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ANSGAR'S LUTHERAN CHURCH - DAY In back of a packed church, Millie whispers with WADE BRODT, 60, a bald, bullet-shaped man. The conversation is discreet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guy had it all. Everything you'd ever want. Y'know he flew a Cessna? In his spare time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I always say people like that-- who live fast? They die hard. Look at River Phoenix.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything you'd ever want.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just don't know. To do those things to yourself. Just perverted. (SIGH) Who ever heard of such a thing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09 CLOSE ON ROGER LEMKE'S CASKET Roger Lemke looks peaceful in death, although it's hard to miss the marks on his neck left behind by the belt. Tim is at the front of a long line of uneasy MOURNERS. Tim holds back tears as he gently touches the marks on Lemke's neck. Tim steps aside to greet the widow Gwen Lemke in a receiving line. The grief has left her gaunt. She appears medicated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm... Gwen, I'm so sorry. Roger is-- was-- is-- a personal hero to me. He just... he had it all. If there's... He is interrupted by Bill Krogstad's sobs. Tim reaches out to put a comforting hand on Gwen's shoulder, but somehow ends up touching her breast instead. A moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm... Tim nods sadly as he removes his hand. He walks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The drab office is brightened with week-old funeral flowers and flaccid mylar sympathy balloons. Tim sits across from a young couple, KURT & PAM GAMBSKY, 20s, in a small, glassed-in conference room. The couple is tense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You just don't get it, Kurt...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw Christ, Pammy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hang on guys, how's this sound-- you can both be right. (pause for effect) I know you're probably thinking, "Oh, an umbrella policy's only for rich people." You know what I say to that? Bull roar. The Gambskys smile, comforted. Tim is good at his job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09 TIM (CONT'D) Pam, Kurt-- I've known you guys since you were little kids. So let's don't think of me as an "insurance salesman." Think of me as your friend who just wants to help you protect your dreams... Tim glances up and sees Bill Krogstad staring longingly at Northlands' three TWO DIAMOND Award plaques. A beat, then Krogstad SLAMS HIS FIST THROUGH THE WOOD PANELED WALL! The couple reels around upon hearing the sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm... Excuse me a sec... Tim exits the conference room and approaches Krogstad, whose hand is now bleeding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: D'you-- can I get you a napkin or something, Bill? For that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Know how Roger used to get down there to Cedar Rapids? To the ASMI Convention? Any idea?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um. I'm with Kurt and Pam Gambsky...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flew himself. In a Cessna. Pilot. (a mournful beat) It was all worked out. I was going to ease into retirement in July while Roger transitioned into his ownership role.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait, Roger was going to buy Northlands?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All worked out. Shit, Dione already put the down payment on a time share. Branson, Black Hills. Florida. Units all over the place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy cow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09 BILL KROGSTAD Yeah, whole deal. Now? Now I got my back up against Christ-knows-what. No Lemke, no buyer, the wife's spending like we won the goddamn Powerball. And what's worse, because of the way, y'know, the way Roger passed... Krogstad chokes up. His grief is very real. So is Tim's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The... belt and the lederhosen...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a nod, a sigh) Quote-unquote perverted, they're saying. Like Northlands has some kind of stain. Oh, I'm so goddamned tired...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is there...? Can I do anything to help, or...? Krogstad hands Tim a Manila folder (bloodying it in the process). Tim gestures for his customers to hold tight. Tim opens the folder, reading aloud from a cover page.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Innovations in Hog Farm Risk Mitigation." Roger's Two Diamond presentation for the ASMI Convention. I helped prepare it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need those Two Diamonds more than ever, Tim. If I'm going to sell this company, we need people to feel OK about the Northlands brand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (not getting it) Mm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd go myself but my daughter Kayla, the heavy one? She unearthed some Polack to marry her. I'm locked into that wedding over in Gladstone. No flex. Locked in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09 TIM Whoa-whoa-wait. What are you saying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not asking you to fill Roger Lemke's shoes. Not gonna happen. I'm asking you to deliver his presentation-- to bring me home those Two Diamonds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't go to ASMI. To Iowa. To Cedar Rapids, Iowa... Why can't Lila do it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon Tim. Lila's about as charismatic as a bag of hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill, I've never... I mean, I've dabbled in hog farm risk mitigation, but I'm no pro... Tim is really starting to panic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were what, 16, when I gave you that filing job? Right after your mom passed? Raising yourself pretty much, living all alone. And I'm thinking, now here's a kid. Here's a kid who's gonna go places. (a hand on Tim's shoulder) And then, somehow, you kind of just didn't. Now, I guess it makes some sense-- a child loses both parents at an early age, becomes what you might call stunted. But cripes almighty, do you want to just sit there in your folks old house, just rot away in Brown Valley dating that... (SUBTLY DISPARAGING) ... woman the rest of your life?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Millie and I are getting married.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tss, maybe three'll be a charm. (then, emotional) (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09 BILL KROGSTAD (CONT'D) Point is, I'm not exactly dancing in the streets here Tim, but it's a perception thing. You go down there to Cedar Rapids, wholesome and pie- eyed and all that. You show them that Northlands is a good outfit-- an upstanding Christian outfit... Tim considers the gravity of this moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw cripes, say you'll do it. Krogstad starts crying again. He hugs Tim, his bloody hand staining Tim's canary yellow V-neck sweater. Tim looks up to see the Gambskys in the conference room staring at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A melancholic yet uplifting song (Leonard Cohen's HALLELUJAH, perhaps) plays as: - Tim puts birdseed in his backyard feeder. He looks at the barren trees as he considers his fate. - Tim Googles "Cedar Rapids." He looks at photos, crime statistics, a Chamber of Commerce Youtube video. He closes his eyes, exhales. - Tim practices the presentation in front of a mirror. He works late. He types. He Power Points. Krogstad critiques. - Tim laminates maps of Cedar Rapids and area attractions. - Tim pulls a dusty American Tourister suitcase from the attic. It looks about 40 years old. He packs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tim looks pensive as he drives. He's wearing a new suit. It's a little too big. A greeting card and a Beanie Baby Rooster bounce along on the passenger's seat. Tim pulls up to a SPLIT-LEVEL HOUSE. A pick-up truck with the words Brodt Heating & Cooling is parked in the driveway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tim pokes his head into a living room, surprised to see Wade, the 60-ish bald guy from church, reclining on a Lazy Boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09 Wade's boots are off. His socks are dirty. He's watching ESPN on a TV with an Olan-Mills portrait of Tim & Millie atop it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, hiya Tim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. Wade. Hey. Is Millie...? Millie enters in a terry cloth robe. A Yorkshire Terrier follows her. Millie acts nonchalant. So does the dog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi Tim. (re. Wade's presence) Wade's cable's down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's six AM...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mike & Mike in the Morning. ESPN 2.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah. Those guys. Hilarious. Ha.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (finally, to Millie) Well I just wanted to... He displays the Beanie Baby and the card. She takes them with a cold smile. Tim notices an identical stuffed rooster on an oak bookshelf-- home to over 155 other Beanie Babies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh shoot. You already have a Strut the Rooster...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So this is it then? (TO WADE) Tim's jetting off to Cedar Rapids this morning, Wade. Big deal insurance convention. Iowa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's only four days.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09 MILLIE Won't go to Germany for our honeymoon, but for work you can just gallivant around like Tom Petty or one of them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We agreed on the Dells... (then, to Millie) Should we maybe talk in the...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh it don't bother me. Tim tries to proceed as if Wade weren't sitting there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I don't try to do this, it's not just my job, Mil. There are four other employees whose lives are on the line. Plus Carol, who does part time seasonal work. So.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not for certain a new owner would even keep you guys on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Bill said he'd make that part of any deal...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Believe you me, Bill Krogstad is looking out for one guy. And that's Bill Krogstad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Krogstad. Tim shoots Wade a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's... Oh, who am I kidding, I'm a little scared here. A lot scared. But not about us. What we've got-- we're like lightning in a bottle, babygirl. I love you so much, Mil. He hugs her. Millie melts just a little, yet remains stern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you to be very careful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09 TIM I know. I will. I mean, Cedar Rapids-- there were only four homicides last year. For a city of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: thousand that's pretty darn good. The forcible rape numbers are admittedly a bit higher, but... She fidgets with his tie. A bitter tear skulks down her cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you to check in with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will every day. Twice a day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make it three times.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: OK, three times! Sheesh. And I'll send a stinkin' telegram, too. Tim kisses the warm tears from Millie's ruddy cheeks. Millie licks her finger and smooths Tim's cowlick. Wade just sits there watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tim walks up to the tiny municipal airport. He tries the door. It's locked. A RETARDED MAN shoveling snow spots Tim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Airport don't open for two hours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks! Just wanna be sure I make my flight. Going down to Cedar Rapids. The big ASMI Convention? The retarded man nods vacantly and goes back to shoveling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tim is the first (and only) person in the security line. An apathetic TSA AGENT awaits him. Tim has a nervous energy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09 TIM Cold enough for you? I'm heading to Cedar Rapids. Supposed to be up in the mid-30s down there. S-weet!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any liquids, gels or aerosols must be placed in a quart-size Zip-Lock. Laptop computers must be taken out of the case and placed in...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoa... what's all this now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any liquids, gels or aerosols...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Tim! Praise Christ you haven't left yet. Bill Krogstad runs up to Tim. He's out of breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Bill, what's going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't believe I forgot to get this to you. Hang on, lemme... Krogstad puts his hands on his knees, takes a few deep breaths. Then he hands Tim a detailed handwritten checklist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's basically an ASMI Convention Bible. It's going to tell you who to talk to, who to avoid, how best to fellowship and network... Tim glances at the list, reads the only name under AVOID.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dean Ziegler, Stevens Point.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ziegler is a cancer. Sonofabitch called one of Lemke's biggest clients-- Joyce Armbruster? Smeared Roger's name and the Northlands' name. Frickin' poacher. Avoid Ziegler like the plague. The fella I got you rooming with, Ronald Wilkes-- that's who you stick by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09 By Ziegler's name, Tim frantically writes, "Poacher" and "Armbruster--" making sure not to forget the umlaut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got the presentation, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Affirmative. Tim untucks his shirt, revealing a zippered cummerbund-like money belt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On me at all times. Plus three back- up discs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey-hey! That kind of prep is pure Lemke! Didn't know any better, I'd say Roger's spirit had kind of climbed into you, just planted its seed inside you there. Atta boy! High praise indeed. Tim hesitates. Is now the right time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill... I have to ask. Let's say one of these big dogs-- your Allstates, your Prudentials-- does decide to go and buy Northlands...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Said it before, I'll say it again: Your job, the office in Brown Valley-- all safe. What you need to worry about is getting down there and representing us the best you can. That's all you need to worry about. Tim swallows hard. Bill brings it in for a hug and inhales Tim's hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tim has a window seat. He reads the safety card. He's sweaty, anxious. A vaguely swarthy MAN (Indian? Italian? Hard to tell.), 40s, sits next to him. A perky FLIGHT ATTENDANT approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You lucky ducks are obviously seated in an exit row. Score! (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09 FLIGHT ATTENDANT (CONT'D) Just gotta make sure you're willing and able to assist crew members in the event of an emergency evacuation... The man smiles nonchalantly. Tim tries to play it cool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're talking what, water landing? (looks around, whispers) Terror type deal? Terrorists...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's really just a formality.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Believe it or not, I have actually never been on an airplane before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, well you'll do awesome.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually, me too. The Ronimal could use a vacation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Done. Dean picks Tim up in a bear hug, spins him around. Ronald gives Tim a more subdued hug. Then there's Joan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So. Keep in touch. E-mail, all that good stuff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bet. You bet. You too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you're ever-- not that you would be-- ever in Oh-my-God, Nebraska...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Mutual of Omaha's Wild Kingdom. I used to watch that. Would be cool some day to see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Look me up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So. He puts out his hand. She laughs and hugs him instead. Tim closes his eyes. She feels so good. Smells so good. Joan's eyes are wide open. She swallows hard. She will not cry. It's OK. Keep telling yourself everything will be OK...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09 INT. PLANE - NIGHT Tim looks out the window, watching the city lights of Cedar Rapids fade away. He catches his reflection in the window. He exhales. He smiles a little. Tim relaxes in his seat. He looks at his seat mate, a pleasant-looking WOMAN in her mid-30s.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, did you do anything fun in Cedar Rapids...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : One Day Later
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tim loads a plate with macaroni, meatloaf, peas and mashed potatoes. Millie selects fish, potatoes, rice and corn. They wordlessly walk from the buffet to a booth. They sit and start eating in silence. After a bit:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's the walleye?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Decent. Not bad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meatloaf's on the dry side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mm. Tim tries to smile at Millie. He is surprised to see that her eyes are filling with tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's...? Without saying a word, Millie struggles to pry the small diamond engagement ring from her sausage-like finger. Finally, she gets it off and hands it to Tim. He thinks of protesting. Instead, he takes the ring and puts it in his pocket. Millie sniffles a bit, composes herself. Tim opens his mouth to say something. Before he can think of anything to say:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09 Wade sits down with a ridiculously full plate of food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit, where were they hidin' the meatloaf...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tim dumps birdseed in the feeder. Sunlight filters through the tree branches. The snow is starting to melt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) You're just gonna attract red squirrels with that junk, Tim. Tim smiles at his old, gnarled neighbor, LESLIE, 80.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How ya doin' there, Leslie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ach, I'm too old to give a shit. They take off their gloves to shake hands. Leslie won't let go of Tim's hand-- the way old men sometimes do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill Krogstad told me he's switching our policy to some fella down in Milwaukee. Allstate. Says I won't notice a bit of difference in coverage or nothin'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you probably won't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mm. Anyhow, I told the cocksucker to go fuck himself. Says I'm going with Tim Lippe. A man I can trust. (A WINK) It's a good thing you're doin'-- keepin' work in Brown Valley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm trying... Leslie pats Tim on the shoulder. As he heads back inside:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09 LESLIE Let me know when them red squirrels show up at your feeder. I'll borrow you my 22. Tim chuckles. He goes back to his yard. He pauses. At his feeder: A robin. A sure sign of spring. An uplifting song fades in, along with:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) The chances we take in life are called risks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - ON A LAKE: Tim is pulled behind a boat on waterskis. He falls face first, skipping across the lake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) We pay insurance companies premiums as a way of hedging our bets, in case those risks we take cause us or our property harm. - AT A BALL DIAMOND: Tim, playing in a summer softball league, slides headfirst into third base.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) That's the point of insurance-- so we can live and love life to the fullest. - AT A STRIP MALL: A COUPLE walks past a discount shoe store and into TIM LIPPE INSURANCE. The camera follows them into the cramped, decidedly unimpressive office. Tim, seated at a desk, looks directly at the camera and stiffly addresses it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At Tim Lippe Insurance, we can't guarantee that you'll live your life without devastating losses. But we can give you peace of mind-- knowing that if something awful or unfortunate does happen-- we'll have you covered. Tim Lippe Insurance. Insuring your Home and your Hopes.
direction.name: direction
